main_definition: Hebrew is primarily a language spoken by the Jewish people, but it also refers to the culture, history, and religious texts associated with Judaism.

meanings_and_examples.example: Most of the Hebrew Bible was written in Biblical Hebrew.
Many Jewish people speak Hebrew as their native tongue.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Related to Judaism and the Jewish culture
meanings_and_examples.example: Hebrew festivals like Hanukkah are celebrated by many Jews around the world.
The ancient Hebrew alphabet, also known as the Phoenician alphabet, is one of the earliest alphabets in human history.
